system.biography:
TitleFFF 311-1 Hideworker
Birthday1 Nuzyael 698
AppearanceAge 21, height 5â 11â, heavy frame, weight 182 lb, plain appearance, medium complexion, black hair, grey eyes
Medical/PsycheMissing teeth
Size7
ArmorLeather shoes, leggings and tunic and mantel, cloth shirt. He wraps his knuckles with leather strips.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables2d in silver
Notes

Biography

Barris of Gorn is a journeyman hideworker. His master owns one of the local franchises and considers the young man quite skilled for one so early in his career. The journeyman is especially noted for his high quality leather boots. He works hard, spending his days preparing hides, mixing chemical concoctions to treat the leather and complete all manner of fetid tasks. The son of an ostler, Barris has a good sense of which hides will make the best saddles or tack and is usually able to sell these to his father at a slight premium.

Instead of saving his hard earned coin, Barris enjoys spending his money on drinking and wenching. When the dayâs duties are complete, he can be found drinking and carousing with his friends. At the close of the evening, Barris likes to engage in a âgood ruckusâ, as he is fond o calling it. These brawls have lead to several missing teeth, a broken nose, scarred ears and a few cracked ribs. The damage he has meted out is far worse. With his size, skill and stamina, few of the locals are willing to trade blows with him anymore.

The lack of local opponents has led to a new spectator sport, loosely called âTraveller Baitingâ. Whenever there are strangers in town, the locals try to manoeuvre them into a confrontation with Barris. Bets are quietly laid on the outcome. The local constabulary is unofficially involved to ensure things donât get too far out of hand. They will intervene if weapons are drawn. They profit by occasionally âfiningâ Barris and his opponents in return for keeping them out of the Lordâs dungeon.

Barrisâ master has implored him to stop his brawling many times, but he continues to fight. The head hideworker tolerates this behaviour only so long as Barris continues to show up for work every morning, put in a good daysâ work and produce high quality goods.

Adventure Hooks

Strangers in Town. The PCs experience âTraveller Baitingâ first hand. If the PCs seriously injure Barris, the local officials will not be lenient.

A Lesson in Manners. Not everyone is as amused as the locals by Barrisâ behaviour. A former victim hires the PCs to teach him a lesson he wonât soon forget.

An Accidental Death. One of Barrisâ opponents has died from his injuries. Knowing his likely fate, he has fled. The PCs are hired to bring him to justice.

A Reformed Man. The love of a good woman has mellowed Barris. He now lives peacefully, raising his family. This changes when he believes, rightly or wrongly, that one of the PCs has wronged his beloved wife.
